abstract: Neighborhood Joint column on Pocha 32, restaurant in Midtown Manhattan's Koreatown neighborhood, where decor of green fishnet drapery and oil drum tables is meant to mimic South Korea's pojangmacha, tented taverns.
lead_paragraph: The décor of the Koreatown restaurant evokes the makeshift taverns in South Korea called pojangmacha (“covered wagons”), or pocha for short.

headline.main: Tented Walls and Family-Style Korean Dishes at Pocha 32
headline.print_headline: Covered Wagon on West 32nd Street, Ho!

snippet: The décor of the Koreatown restaurant evokes the makeshift taverns in South Korea called pojangmacha (“covered wagons”), or pocha for short.
